text: Henry Holmes (October 12, 1827 – March 5, 1865) commanded a detachment of Confederate soldiers during the Battle of Picacho Pass. He was captured by Union forces under the command of Lieutenant James Barrett and taken to Yuma, Arizona where he died in prison before the end of the war. He is buried at Yuma National Cemetery in Arizona after several attempts to escape. He was shot during one of these attempts. ==See also== *Jack Swilling *Sherod Hunter Category:1827 births Category:1865 deaths Category:Confederate States Army soldiers Category:Confederate States military personnel killed in the American Civil War Category:Military personnel from Tucson, Arizona Category:People of Arizona in the American Civil War
title: Henry Holmes (Confederate soldier)
